newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani vegoil rates seen up next week.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani vegoil rates seen up next week.

text.p: Pakistani vegetable oil rates may firm next week in line with international prices that have been boosted by fresh demand ahead of Christmas and the Moslem fasting month of Ramadan, dealers said on Saturday.
"Local prices will follow international prices which have gained on demand from Indonesia, which wants to ensure enough supply before Christmas and Ramadan," dealer Amir Chattha said.
He said the last Ghee Corporation of Pakistan (GCP) tender had also helped keep international prices firm.
Dealers said vegoil stocks fell to 112,000 tonnes last week from 127,000 tonnes a week earlier.

RBD palm oil and palm olein stocks eased to 85,000 tonnes from 87,000, while soybean oil and sunflower oil stocks dropped to 20,000 tonnes from 30,000. The GCP has 7,000 tonnes of palm oil and palm olein in stock to 10,000 last week.
The Wawasan Courage was discharging 13,900 tonnes of palm oil at Port Qasim. Wawasan Murni with around 25,000 tonnes of palm oil was on the high seas and due to arrive by November 2.
The Petr Shmdit was due in mid-November with 10,000 tonnes of soybean oil and Wawasan Megah on November 8 with 25,000 tonnes of palm oil.
Dealers offered the following prices for vegoils: (price indication C&F Karachi per tonne: Sat Oct 26
Local prices in rupees ($1 = 40.22) per maund (37.32 kg)
